metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34476 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ASN.1 parsing of an indefinite SEQUENCE inside an indefinite GROUP could have resulted in the parser accepting malformed ASN.1. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34476` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
